Kansas City, Mo. Bruce B. Brewer Company, Inc.
"Jobs — Not A Handout" is the theme of the Kansas City JOBS program.
It is supported by TV and radio spots, and small space newspaper advertising.
All advertisers in area were supplied with "Jobs - Not A Handout" mats by
coordinating agency to be used in all advertising. Radio commercials
reached a frequency of about one every fifteen minutes over four-week
period.
San Francisco, Calif. Hoefer, Dieterich & Brown, Inc.
Oakland, Calif. Honig-Cooper & Harrington
These coordinating agencies have been working together to obtain heavy
Bay Area coverage for summertime JOBS. McCann-Erickson has worked with
Hoefer, Dieterich in producing 2U-sheet posters and transit advertising.
All 28 Bay Area radio stations have been running heavy schedules of spots
prepared by Honig-Cooper. TV support —- spots, interviews and news shows —
also has been outstanding. San Francisco Advertising Club, the Chamber of
Commerce and Junior League are among the organizations recruited to help.
"Hard core" job quota almost met, all media cooperating in crash program to
meet summer job quota. Oakland's job effort climaxed with a 90-minute TV
"Job-In" solicitation.
Oklahoma City, Okla. Richard Roby Adv. Associates, Inc.
The city's Operation Job Alert established a One-Day Work program for
youths lb to 16. Workers are "contracted" to home owners for window
washing, lawn mowing, etc., with transportation furnished by Job Alerts
